mng: to bring up, to rear, Taiwan pr. [ju2]

exm.mng: to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to bend to a task and spare no effort unto one's dying day (idiom); striving to the utmost one's whole life, with every breath in one's body, unto one's dying day
exm.pyn: jū gōng jìn cuì , sǐ ér hòu yǐ

exm.mng: to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost, same as 鞠躬盡瘁|鞠躬尽瘁[ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4]
to bend to a task and spare no effort unto one's dying day (idiom); striving to the utmost one's whole life, with every breath in one's body, unto one's dying day
